sentences.en: “hauled off and smacked the hapless aide across the face”(&b{Bill Barol})
sentences.cn: “缩回手臂然后狠狠掴在这个不幸的副官脸上”(&b{比尔·巴罗尔})

sentences.en: Another break-in yielded a £4,000 haul of jewellery.
sentences.cn: 另一次入室盗窃偷得了价值4,000英镑的首饰。

sentences.en: He told the chief officer to haul the ship off four points.
sentences.cn: 他告诉大副改变船的航向偏开四个罗经点.

sentences.en: I hauled the door shut behind me.
If we can get some strong ropes or wires around the sunken boat, we might be able to haul it up.
sentences.cn: 如果能用一些结实的绳子或金属缆绳拴在沉船的周围, 或许我们能把它拖上来.

sentences.en: If you haul hard you will divert the fish.
sentences.cn: 如果拉网太猛,鱼会被吓跑的.

sentences.en: It was a long haul doing the degree part - time, but it was worth it.
sentences.cn: 在职攻读学位的过程虽然费时很长且很辛苦, 但是非常值得.

sentences.en: It was a long haul home and we arrived exhausted.
sentences.cn: 搬运回家的这段路程特别长,到家时我们已筋疲力尽.

sentences.en: It's been a long haul but at last this dictionary is published.
sentences.cn: 经过千辛万苦这部字典才终于得以问世.

sentences.en: Passengers on long-haul flights are being warned about the risks of deep vein thrombosis.
sentences.cn: 长途航班上的乘客须注意可能出现深静脉血栓。

sentences.en: Revitalising the Romanian economy will be a long haul.
sentences.cn: 罗马尼亚经济的复兴将是一项长期而艰巨的工作。

sentences.en: Short-haul flights operate from Heathrow and Gatwick.
sentences.cn: 希思罗和盖特威克之间有短程航班。

sentences.en: The fisherman had a good haul.
The gang escaped with a haul worth hundreds of pounds.
sentences.cn: 匪徒带着价值几百英镑的赃物逃跑了。

sentences.en: The murder weapon was part of a haul stolen in a raid on a South African air-force arsenal in 1990.
sentences.cn: 1990年南非空军武器库遭到突袭，这件凶器就是当时被盗走的武器中的一件。

sentences.en: The rope stood up under the strain of the haul.
the steam locomotive which hauled the train
This is the cableway which the lumberjacks use to haul out their timber.
sentences.cn: 这就是林业工人用以运送木材的空中索道.

words.tran_cn: 拖，拉；用力拖拉；努力得到的结果；捕获物；一网捕获的鱼量；拖运距离
拖，拉；改变主意；改变方向

phrases.tran_cn: 运距；运输距离；行程长度；运程长度
绞入；拉进，靠拢；引船进坞
撤走：改变作战计划到新的地方；离开
短途；短时间；短距旅行；短程运输

trans.tran_cn: 拖，大批赃物，一网的捕获量，拖运货物的距离
trans.tran_en: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net
to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

trans.tran_en: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement
to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement
